data.title: Attentive Bar Staff
data.text: Another really good brew pub. Great atmosphere and selection of beers to try. The bartender was awesome with her suggestions. Very good vibe, easy going. We did not try the food, and in fact were advised not to. However great place to hang out and try some beer!

data.title: Nice Hole in the Wall Pub
data.text: I was not expecting such an excellent beer selection.  Not fancy.  Normal liquor choices.  Bartenders were friendly and knowledgeable.  A good place to wind down after work or post-dinner.

data.title: Great Beer
data.text:
This is exactly what Owensboro needed, a relaxing spot to enjoy outstanding beers. I've never had any food here, but I know they have a small menu selection. 

You can try a wide variety of delicious craft beers, and they have a rotating handle. The servers are knowledgeable and can recommend selections based on your preferences.

Highly recommend!

data.title: MIA
data.text: This is a nice drinking spot, hip and relaxing, but the first three drafts I tried ordering were out. Tried ordering the bottle beer that came with the free glass and of course they were out of those too. Not really a restaurant souf you are looking for food, food I would recommend going elsewhere. If I were in town for pleasure I would return, but not for business.

owner_response.author: kinggambrinus, Owner at Gambrinus Libation Emporium, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We're sorry that you left unsatisfied with your visit.  Sadly, TripAdvisor doesn't give us the option to be a "Bar" instead of a restaurant, so it can be misleading in that regard.  However, we do happily allow our patrons to order food from any of our neighbors and they will, usually, bring it right to you at your seat in Gambrinus.

As for the drafts that were out...  We recently had our International Beer Festival and had on 26 rare brews, all of which you attempted to order.  We were lucky they lasted as long as they did, but sadly didn't make it until you arrived.  We still had 23 great drafts for you to choose from and many of those were still rarities as well, not to mention the 80+ bottles to select from.

On our "BUY THE BEER, KEEP THE GLASS" nights we only had a limited supply of glassware to give away and they're usually gone pretty early.  I'm sorry you arrived after everyone else who also wanted the glasses.  Sadly we don't get an unlimited number of glasses to give away every Tuesday, which is kind of what makes the event special.  We still had the bottles available though.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great beer!
data.text: I'm not much for the food at Gambrinus, but I go there for the great beer!  Gambrinus carries a wide variety of area beers and beers from around the nation.  Owensboro is lucky to have this place!

data.title: Good selection of beers.
data.text: Cozy bar vibe, and being downtown it is a nice location. Typical drink pricing for the area and some nice outdoor seating. Some light bar fare you can order.

data.title: Ground Zero for the best craft beers in Western Kentucky
data.text: Owners are very knowledgeable in craft beers and the history of the area. The downtown area of Owensboro has been revitalized to an urban nightlife. This place is ground zero for all things fun in downtown Owensboro, Kentucky.

data.title: Too many great ales for one evening
data.text: Very nice pub atmosphere with more ales that I can drink.  I will be back!!  As the draft ales change frequently, there will be no problem finding good ones!

data.title: Love this place!!
data.text: I have been coming here for years.  Living in Nashville, i don't mind the prices for the drinks.  I always have a good time here no matter who I am with.  When i cone to visit Owensboro I try to stop off here at least once.

data.title: A must if you are in Owensboro!
data.text: We love Gambrinus, it is a great place to meet friends after dinner. I love the selection of martinis and different drinks. The beer selection does not include your typical Bud and Miller, but the staff will help you find something you like!

data.title: The worst experiance.
data.text: After traveling all day you want friendly bartender  a drink and a bite to eat. Nice enough visually I guess, the service had no knowledge I was ready to get deep into some great bourbon just arriving in Owensboro.... well trying to get a recommendation was like pulling teeth, I hate when people don't sell me and don't have opinions . There food offering could have been presented better the dry rub on cheese could have been fun , the spring rolls were not worth the plate served on . I of course could have sworn there was a manger or owner type there, who was in ear shot of all of this and did not offer any help or enthusiasm . Just sad really sad......

data.title: been there often and it is not worth it
data.text:
I have been there several times and every time they have some excuse like they
are too busy- or are short staffed - and they are way overpriced - so I will not go back.
I would avoid this on your visit to Owensboro!

data.title: Perfect Pub
data.text: Huge selection of beers, friendly staff and a nice mixed crowd of people here. The snickers cocktail is  incredible. The snacks were good too. Great place to hangout would definitely recommend it

data.title: Great experience!  Very relaxed and comfortable
data.text: Just stopped by for a beer with friends and had a great time.  Amazing selection of beers.  Tue you can keep the glass :)  Sit inside or out on the sidewalk.  Décor is very nice and staff is very friendly.

data.title: great experience
data.text: My lady friend went to Gambrinus yesterday afternoon. Had a couple of drinks and a snack, very good.

data.title: #1 Bar in Town
data.text: I don't go to bars much but when I do this is the one. Love the variety and changing menu of beers. Great environment and you can actually talk to others instead of trying to scream. Very knowledgeable staff.

data.title: Cute place
data.text: I was in Owensboro for a conference & stopped by here with a large group.  Cute little place.  Drinks were good, but the kitchen closes way too early.

data.title: Needs to stay open later
data.text: A bunch of us went to this bar for the first time and was very impressed.  They had a great beer selection, good outside seating, and great décor.  My only complaint is that they close at midnight even on a Saturday night even though bars in Owensboro are allowed to stay open until 2am.  A wedding party of about 40 people showed up at 1130 and they still would not keep the bar open and proceeded to kick everyone out.  After getting the boot, the entire contents of the bar walked across the street to go to CYO which is open later.  Why would Gambrinus not want that business, strange management decision.

data.title: Gorgeous Bar and drink selection!
data.text: As though Owensboro doesn’t have enough to see and absorb, we fell in love with this place when we were first falling in love with each other!  First, the name!  Really?  It beckons “Come have a cocktail like you’ve never had before!”  Walking in the beautiful doors, you are suddenly swept away by the GORGEOUS bar, the woodwork surrounding you, the reflection of early evening sunlight in the mirrors, and the seating that invites you to exhale as you sink down into it!  This place is a cool oasis after exploring the riverfront… a step back in time when the clink of ice cubes in heavy glassware was the tops in style and taste.  Our favorite seat?  The round booth that urges you to snuggle with your date as you nibble interesting bar bites.  Although it doesn’t feel in any way like a sports bar, you can STILL catch the scores of the current games playing on any one of the screens.  Try something different, like one of their signature cocktails with a plethora of seasonal flavors!  We did, and now, it’s on our list for every visit!”

data.title: Classy, high-end bar/pub
data.text: My wife and I have been having our weekly date-night at Gambrinus for 4 years now.  We love the staff.  The service is wonderful.  The selection of craft beers is phenomenal.  They have, I believe, over 20 craft brews on tap at any given time and numerous bottled beers.  The ambience is relaxing.  This is a non-smoking establishment and for those less well-cultured as it relates to beer, you will not find any of the mass produced national brands at Gambrinus.  They also have a full bar, large Martini menu, solid wine list and a selection of appetizers.  Great place to go to unwind and spent time with friends.
